Programming with Scratch

http://scratch.mit.edu/

If you have a little bit of experience using Hour of Code or some other basic programming language/environment, we suggest that you really learn about programming by studying Scratch. Even if you have played with Scratch on your own or in school, we suggest that you work through the following materials to build a better foundation for programming.

Level 0 Activities - Getting Started with Scratch

We suggest you complete the following activities in order. Even if you have already worked with scratch these are good activities to review.

  • Tutorial : Introducing Scratch and Registering for an Account
  • Activity : Exploring Scratch
  • Activity : Scratch Surprise
  • Tutorial : How to share a Project in a Studio
  • Activity : Step by Step
  • Activity : 12 Blocks

Level 1 Activities - Learning about the possibilities in Scratch

We suggest that you complete the following activities in order. However, for the most part you can do them in any order that you like. To get the most out of this level we strongly suggest you finish each of the activities before completing the Mastery Activities.

  • Activity : An Initial Assignment (Absolute/Coordinate motion and the pen menu)
  • Activity : Getting in Shape (Relational/Directional motion and the pen menu)
  • Activity : Debug It #1 (Practicing debugging)
  • Activity : Build a Band (The sound menu)
  • Activity : Orange Square, Purple Circle (The looks menu)
  • Activity : It's Alive (Using Costumes)
  • Activity : Debug It #2 (More Practice debugging)

Mastery Activities are designed to be demonstrations of the material you have learned in a level. Only after you have mastered the concepts in this level should you attempt to complete the following activities.

  • Mastery Activity : About Me
  • Mastery Activity : Music Video

Level 2 Activities - Telling Stories

We suggest that you complete the following activities in order. However, for the most part you can do them in any order that you like. To get the most out of this level we strongly suggest you finish each of the activities before completing the Mastery Activities.

  • Activity : Knock Knock Joke version 1 (Using timing to coordinate sprites)
  • Activity : Knock Knock Joke version 2 (Using broadcasts to coordinate sprites)
  • Activity : It's a Crazy Scene Man (Exploring the stage a little more)
  • Activity : Debug It #3
  • Activity : Remixing a scene from Harry Potter
  • Activity : Remixing a scene of your choice

Mastery Activities are designed to be demonstrations of the material you have learned in a level. Only after you have mastered the concepts in this level should you attempt to complete the following activities.

  • Mastery Activity : Animating a Nursery Rhyme
  • Mastery Activity : Scene It: Animating a Scene from your favorite Book, TV Show or Movie

Level 3 Activities - Working with Data

We suggest you complete the following activities in order. These build on each other to help you learn a little bit about data and selection statements. We suggest that you complete each of these activities before attempting the Mastery Activities. In earlier levels we have walked you through concepts in detail. From now on we will present a lot of code examples and ask you to explore and ask questions from the mentors to figure things out.

  • Activity : Using Ask to Customize Stories
  • Activity : Using selection statements to add in options
  • Activity : Your Turn#1
  • Activity : Using Numbers as Inputs
  • Activity : Your Turn#2

Mastery Activities are designed to be demonstrations of the material you have learned in a level. Only after you have mastered the concepts in this level should you attempt to complete the following activities.

  • Mastery Activity : Mad Libs
  • Mastery Activity : Choose Your Own Adventure

Level 4 Activities - Creating Games

We suggest that you complete the following activities in order. However, for the most part you can do them in any order that you like. To get the most out of this level we strongly suggest you finish each of the activities before completing the Mastery Activities.

  • Activity : Dream Game Brainstorm
  • Activity : Game Exploration
  • Activity : Creating a Maze Game
  • Activity : Creating a Pong Game
  • Activity : Creating a Scrolling Game
  • Activity : Using Data to Keep Score
  • Activity : Extending your Game
  • Activity : Exploring Interaction
  • Activity : Debug It #4

Mastery Activities are designed to be demonstrations of the material you have learned in a level. Only after you have mastered the concepts in this level should you attempt to complete the following activities.

  • Mastery Activity : Create Your Dream Game

Level 5 Activities - Beyond the Basics

These topics can be studied in any order. However, you should not attempt these until you have mastered earlier levels.

  • Activity : Know, Want, Learn
  • Activity : Contributing to the Community - Create an Activity
  • Activity : Contributing to the Community - Create a Debug It
  • Activity : Using Lists
  • Activity : Building your own blocks
  • Activity : Cloning
  • Activity : Video Sensing
  • Activity : External Hardware
